title: JSON data + RML template = PDF report
summary:
[EuroPython 2011] Stefano Cotta Ramusino - 23 June 2011 in "Track
Ravioli"
description:
The main problem with reports generated in Python is how to separate the
content from the style using ReportLab library, because all informations
should be saved in a single source file that, by example, is impossible
to understand for your graphic designer.

So the solution: just modularizes all components you need and identify
simple container formats for your data input (JSON) and document
template (ReportLab RML).

Now with the power of Genshi and XInclude we will create dynamic
templates that include specific snippets (e.g., to generate on the fly a
decent graph with matplotlib or cairoplot to fill some lacks of
ReportLab) and we will detach the stylesheet from the template
structure.

And at the end you can also have the internationalization service in the
PDF report generation!
